edu.cnm.deepdive.security

Class PasswordGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.security.PasswordGenerator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SecurePasswordGenerator

    public class PasswordGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of a simple password generator. This includes support for elementary character-set-based rules, but not (yet) regular expressions.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sky Link

      protected java.util.Random rng

      Constructor that allows user to specify values of all instance fields of the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String generate()
      Establishes a pool of characters to be chosen from and then creates a password that consists of random characters from the pool and is between the minimum and maximum length.

      • PasswordGenerator

        public PasswordGenerator(int minLength,
                         int maxLength,
                         boolean includeUpperCase,
                         boolean includeLowerCase,
                         boolean includeNumbers,
                         boolean includePunctuation,
                         boolean excludeAmbiguous)
        Constructor that allows user to specify values of all instance fields of the class.
        Parameters:
        minLength - The minimum length of the password.
        maxLength - The maximum length of the password.
        includeUpperCase - Allow upper case in the password?
        includeLowerCase - Allow lower case in the password?
        includeNumbers - Allow numbers in the password?
        includePunctuation - Allow punctuation in the password?
        excludeAmbiguous - Exclude lower case "l" and upper case "O"?

      • generate

        public java.lang.String generate()
        Establishes a pool of characters to be chosen from and then creates a password that consists of random characters from the pool and is between the minimum and maximum length.
